===Creation===
When scientist [[Herbert Wyndham (Earth-616)|Herbert Wyndham]] was approached by a [[Phaeder (Earth-616)|mysterious benefactor]] in the early 20th century, he was given the resources and knowledge to construct a massive research lab on [[Wundagore Mountain]] in the Eastern European country of [[Transia]] to conduct his experiments on evolution and genetics.{{r|Quicksilver Vol 1 9}} From his work, he created the [[New Men]], humanoid creatures evolved from normal animals and given human-level intelligence.{{r|Thor Vol 1 134}}

Soon afterward, the Evolutionary is approached by the spirit of a sixth-century sorcerer [[Magnus (Sorcerer) (Earth-616)|Magnus]] inhabiting the body of his assistant, [[Jonathan Drew]], who warns him of the coming of [[Chthon (Earth-616)|Chthon]], and ancient evil sealed beneath the mountain.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Annual Vol 1 22}} In order to repel him, Magnus offers to train the New Men in the art of combat and chivalry like the heroes of his day, The Knights of the Round Table. The Knights of Wundagore are formed, and Chthon, attacking through a host body called [[Other|The Other]], is defeated.{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Annual Vol 1 22}}

Using a new isotope, The Evolutionary created the [[Man-Beast (Earth-616)|Man-Beast]], an evolved from wolf with mental powers, who quickly ousted his creator from his citadel in a bid to take over the world.{{r|Thor Vol 1 134}} [[Thor Odinson (Earth-616)|Thor]] helps the Knights to defeat the Man-Beast, but the Evolutionary decides to take his citadel into space to seek a new destiny for his creations.{{r|Thor Vol 1 135}}

===Into Space===
The High Evolutionary, converting his citadel into a spaceship, left earth along with his Knights. After creating his own version of Earth known as [[Counter-Earth (High Evolutionary)|Counter-Earth]], The Evolutionary and his Knights are attacked by Man-Beast, who followed them to the new world with his own New Men.{{r|Marvel Premiere Vol 1 1}} With the help of [[Adam Warlock (Earth-616)|Adam Warlock]], the Man-Beast is defeated and partially devolved.{{r|Warlock Vol 1 2}}

The High Evolutionary later migrated his New Men to a planet in the [[Sirius (Star)|Sirius]] solar system he called [[Wundagore II]]. Giving in to their animalistic nature, all New Men, including the Knights, eventually became savage and warlike. With their society threatened, the Evolutionary evolved himself into possessing god-like psionic powers and devolved his own creations, including the Knights, back into normal animals. 

Some time later, this world would be discovered by [[Arcturus (Rigellian) (Earth-616)|Commander Arcturus]] of the [[Rigellians|Rigellian]] colonizers who was seeking a new homeworld to use as a staging ground to wage war against his people's leader, the [[Rigellian Grand Commissioner (Earth-616)|Grand Commissioner]]. When one of Arcturus' irradiated probes lands on Wundagore II, it creates a mutagenic effect which evolves all the New Men back to their humanoid forms. Arcturus' fleet attacks the planet, but are ultimately repelled by a collaboration of the Knights, [[Anthony Stark (Earth-616)|Iron Man]], the [[Jonathan Hart (Earth-616)|Jack of Hearts]], and the [[Soviet Super-Soldiers (Earth-616)|Soviet Super-Soldiers]]. The New Men re-formed their society and, now led by the Knight [[Sir Lyan (Earth-616)|Sir Lyan]], continued to live in peace.

===Siege of Wundagore===
Returning to Earth, the High Evolutionary must fight to reclaim his former home of Wundagore Mountain from the [[Acolytes (Earth-616)|Acolytes]], who see the site as holy ground since it was the last known location of [[Max Eisenhardt (Earth-616)|Magneto]]'s wife, [[Magda Eisenhardt (Earth-616)|Magda]].{{r|Avengers Vol 1 380}} To prevent further attacks, he creates a new team of Knights to watch over his citadel, who eventually do battle with the Acolytes and [[Genoshan Mutates]] during their attempt to re-take the mountain.{{r|Quicksilver Vol 1 1}} Forced to retreat, the Knights re-group at their New York base, The Haven, and the Evolutionary appoints [[Pietro Maximoff (Earth-616)|Quicksilver]] as the new team leader while he recouperates in the [[Savage Land]].{{r|Quicksilver Vol 1 2}}

When the Evolutionary's Savage Land base is attacked by mutants hired by [[Bennet du Paris (Earth-616)|Exodus]], the Knights come to his aid, only to find out that one of their members, Lord Anon, is in fact the Man-Beast, having killed the original holder of the name, [[Sir Wulf (Earth-616)|Sir Wulf]].{{r|Quicksilver Vol 1 11}} The Knights later team up with the [[Heroes for Hire (Oracle Inc.) (Earth-616)|Heroes for Hire]] and are able to re-claim their home from the combined forces of Man-Beast and the Acolytes.{{r|Heroes for Hire / Quicksilver Vol 1 '98}} Quicksilver leaves the team shortly afterward.{{r|Quicksilver Vol 1 13}}

===Endangered Species===
After the events of [[M-Day]], where the majority of Earth's mutants lost their powers and the X-Gene was seemingly wiped from humanity, the X-Man [[Henry McCoy (Earth-616)|Beast]] travels to Wundagore Mountain to meet with the Evolutionary to find a way to reverse it. There, he meets with a new group of Knights led by [[Snow Queen (New Men) (Earth-616)|Snow Queen]], who attack him before his audience.{{r|Uncanny X-Men Vol 1 488}}

===Earth's Mightiest===
In an attempt to summon the [[Elder Gods of Earth|Elder God]] Chthon back into the world, the dark magician [[Modred (Earth-616)|Modred]] seized control of the Dark Hold cavern underneath Wundagore Mountain, killing every Knight present, except for Bova, before being defeated by the [[Mighty Avengers (Pym) (Earth-616)|Mighty Avengers]].{{r|Mighty Avengers Vol 1 21}} It is unknown which Knights specifically were slain during the attack.
